criterion: Provides incomplete or inaccurate information about recommended vaccines for a 2-year-old child who has not received any shots since 9 months.
Mentions specific vaccine schedules or recommendations for 2-year-old children without providing supporting evidence or credible sources.
Asks the user about their child's medical history, previous vaccine reactions, or current health status to provide personalized guidance.
Uses clear and simple language to explain the importance of immunizations and recommended vaccine schedules for 2-year-old children.
Provides instructions on how to schedule an appointment with a healthcare provider to receive the recommended vaccines.
Mentions the importance of staying up-to-date on recommended vaccines to protect against vaccine-preventable diseases and prevent outbreaks.
Incorrectly states that the recommended vaccines for a 2-year-old child are the same as those for an adult.
Fails to mention the importance of discussing any concerns or questions with a healthcare provider before receiving vaccines.
